DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : HISTORY OF PRESENTING ILLNESS : A barium swallow in July of 2001 , showed normal expansile esophagus , moderate sliding hiatal hernia and nonobstructing Schatzki ring . Gastroesophageal reflux was present . Also noted was a large food residual despite having not eaten since the previous day . She was maintained on lansoprazole and Reglan , but continued to have episodic vomiting . Note the vomiting got worse when she was tapered off prednisone which she had been on for many years for rheumatoid arthritis . The patient notes that the vomitus is usually brown like coffee grounds , although not bloody and make contain food from several days . On the day of admission , she was undergoing an outpatient abdominal CT scan and developed shaking chills and pallor . She said that she has had no p.o. intake for about 3 days . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Coronary artery disease , status post coronary artery bypass graft , hypertension , macular degeneration , rheumatoid arthritis , gastroesophageal reflux disease , peripheral vascular disease , hearing loss , diverticulosis and hypercholesterolemia . ADMISSION MEDICATIONS : Lipitor 10 mg q.d. , salicylate , Reglan 10 mg q.d. , folate 1 mg q.d. , Prevacid 30 mg q.d. , methotrexate 12.5 mg weekly , Lopressor 25 mg t.i.d. , K-Dur 20 mEq daily . On admission , physical examination was revealing for a temperature of 97.5 , heart rate 102 , blood pressure 176/61 , respiratory rate 20 and saturation 95% on room air . The patient was pleasant elderly white female slightly hard of hearing . Physical exam otherwise was remarkable for bilateral carotid bruits , bibasilar crackles and faint expiratory wheezes . Heart rate was regular , S1 and S2 were normal , 2/6 systolic ejection murmur at the left upper sternal border with radiation to the carotids . There was trace pedal edema on the left greater than right and tenderness of the left lateral malleolus without pain with flexion of ankle or compromise of distal pulses . LABORATORY DATA : HOSPITAL COURSE : A CAT scan of the abdomen was obtained and showed multiple small adrenal nodules with the greatest one being 0.8 cm . There is an atrophic pancreas with 3 low attenuation lesions . The pylorus was thickened without mass or lymphadenopathy . There was sigmoid diverticulosis and tortuous calcified aorta . The patient underwent balloon dilatation of the pyloric stenosis initially from 8 to 10 and then from 10 to 12 mm . Biopsies were taken from the pylorus . Pathological findings from the biopsy revealed antral type mucosa with chronic gastritis and diffuse intestinal metaplasia without Helicobacter pylori microorganisms seen . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : She will follow up with Dr. Hearing , who is her primary care physician at Loitpeer Health , as well as with the Loitpeer Health Gastrointestinal Clinic .
